page.title: 01THE KINGSCLERE AREA.
page.content: Kingsclere lies in the northern part of Hampshire, between Newbury in Berkshire and Basingstoke.Kingsclere's present population is about 3,070.The village is in a valley below the chalk downs. The centre of Kingsclere consists of an old church, a chapel, several old houses and a few shops, grouped in two streets near the square. There are newer housing estates around the village, and more houses are being built at present on two new estates. Two miles east of Kingsclere is the smaller village of Wolverton.It has a park, Wolverton Park, with a lake, a large house and farmland. There is an attractive church on the edge of the estate. The rest of the area is occupied by farms and the racing stables with their training gallops.
